Entry.4: 9-30am. Left lines G.S. Waggon & 4 mules. Reported to T.M. at Neippe. Went to Steinwerck R.E dump for sandbags, then D.A. for a mile of telephone wire Back to Neippe. Left 3pm. for Gun Pits. Got home about 8 pm.
Entry.11:
Painting waggons

Mounted Stable

Piquet at 5 pm.
Entry.18:
Painting Limbers

Mounted Guard at 5 pm. 

Taken off guard to finish painting
Entry.20:
4-30am

Left lines 4 am with G.S. at Baileuel
Entry.29:
Loading waggons with small arms

Outersteen
Entry.31: parade, 5-15 am. Grooming. 2nd. Parade, 7-45 am. Harnessed up & moved off at 9 am. Arr. Outersteen (4 Kilos from Balliul) about 12 noon. Good stables. Billets in farm loft
Entry.32:
Grooming and harness cleaning.

2 Sat

Grooming and harness cleaning.
Entry.34: Left Champagne 9am.and after travelling over some very heavy roads arr. Remilly-Wilhim 2pm,
Entry.35: Left Remilly-Wilhim about 9am, and arr. at Fauxalles (our destination) 1pm. (Billets in farm barn)
Entry.36:
Packing waggons and putting up lines for mules

Fauxalles
Entry.37:
Grooming and Cleaning Harness

Out for a spell.
Entry.38:
Grooming and Cleaning Harness

Out for a spell.

The nearest village about 3 Kilos away
Entry.39:
Grooming and Cleaning Harness

Out for a spell.

The nearest village about 3 Kilos away
Entry.45: Instructions in Rifle drill by Inf. Sgt.
Entry.51:
Mounted Guard 5pm 6-30pm. taken off guard, & for Blighty leave 7-15pm Went to H.Q. for medical inspection

London
Entry.52: Left camp by G.S. waggon at 8-30am. Arr. LUMBRES 10am. Left by train 10-30am arr. Calais 3-30pm. Left Calais 5-30pm Arr. Dover 7-30pm, left Dover 15 min. later, arr. London about 10pm Marched to H.F. Rd. Tea. Paid & clothes. Into bed about 1am at War Chest club.
Entry.53:
Breakfast 8am. then went to Commonwealth Bank re. money. Spent the rest of the day in London. Left Kings X 10-30pm for Edinburgh

Edinburgh
Entry.55: Spent the day looking about Leith
Entry.56: Met Ted Cowan & Paddy Brodric in Princess St.
Entry.58: Left Edinburgh (Wav.) 1pm & arr. Glasgow 2-6 pm. Met at Queen St station by Bella.
Entry.59: Paid a visit to Bearmore Engineer works. Saw the making of Guns etc.
Entry.62: Hawkhead cemetry (Lair H.420) Paid £2-3 for keep of Lair in Perpetuity Granite headstone Including all charges £16
Entry.63:
Glasgow. Went to Photographer in the forenoon

Princess’s theatre at night.
Entry.66: Should have returned to France today. But intend to have a few more days
Entry.69:
Left Edinburgh (Wav.) 1-45pm & arrived London 11-30pm. Taken from Victoria by Y.M.C.A. taxi to rest hut.

London
Entry.70: Left London 8am. Arr Dover 10am. taken to military barracks where we had dinner at 12-30pm. Embarked 2-30pm. Left Dover 4 pm Arr. Calais 6 pm. & marched to rest camp
Entry.71:
Calais

Rev 6am Left rest camp about 7-30am. & marched to station & issued with rations. Left Calais about 10-30am Arr. Steenwerck 1-30 pm. Arr. Unit (Pont d’ Archelles) about 2-30pm

Pont d’ Achelles.
Entry.72: Harnessed up & left lines with G.S. Waggon for Bailleuel. Fatague work Got back to lines about 3 pm
Entry.73: Grooming and cleaning harness. Mounted stable piquet 5-30 pm
Entry.74: 7-30am. left lines Pulling logs near Romarin.
Entry.78:
8-30am Four mule team to Steenwerck. E.F. Canteen. 

back to lines about 11am.

Painting Horse Ts, for G.S. Waggons
Entry.79:
Painting arrows for G.S. Waggons.

Mounted Piquet 5-30pm Great German Attack on British 3 & 4th Armies on a 50 mile front between the Saape & the Oise
Entry.80: Painting arrows (Horse T) for waggons & notice boards Germans break through British positions west of St. Quentin.
Entry.81:
Left lines at 8-30am Carting from the E.F. Canteen Steenwerck to 2nd Divy. Canteen

24 Sun

Fall of Bapaume Peronne. etc.

Log hauling,

25 Mon

Q.M.S. Ration waggon

Enemy reach near Maricourt their original line of
Entry.83:
Up before the Lieut Col. for overstaying leave Fined 14 days pay 4.R.W. Sent to 2nd. D.A.C. HQ to relieve Dvr. Wigful. Took my two mules & harness. MAIL Driver.

27 Wed

1st Parade 7am. rugs off & fed mules.
Entry.84: parade 9am. Grooming 10am. Harnessed into single Pill box & went to field P.O. in Steenwerck Rd. Took mail to
Entry.85:
section. Back in time for dinner. Harness cleaning in the afternoon. Stable piquet on from 8 to 10

H:Q.
Entry.86: Went for mail at 10-30am. Back to lines- about 1pm. Cleaning Harness in the afternoon
Entry.87:
Fri- Good Friday

Received letter from Comm. Bank stating that they had sent £14-10/-
Entry.88:
Driving the mail to the sections

Pont d’ Achelles.
Entry.90:
Left Pont d’ Achelles 3 pm arrived Farm. about 7 pm. Driving wheel in Limber.

GODEWAESVELDE.
Entry.91: Rev 6-30am fell in 7am, 2nd. Parade 9-30 am, cleaning harness. Dinner then dismissed till 4-30am.
Entry.92:
Rev. 3-30am. fell in 4am. Left camp 5 am. Entrained at Godewaesvelde station Train left 8am. Arr St. Omer, 10am, Calais 12 noon, Abbeville 6pm. Detrained Amiens about 11pm. Travelled about 8 miles to camp. Arr camp 1-30am. Bed 2-30am Camped over night at CARDONETTE

Cardonette. Bussy
 & 
Blangy Tronville
Entry.93:
Did not get out of bed till 11 am. Harnessed up & moved off at 3 pm. Arr. Bussy 5 pm. 10 pm. ordered to harness up again, moved out 
in
 45min. later. Arr Blangy Tronville about 3am.
Entry.94: Rev. 6-30am fell in at 7 am. Fixed up lines & waggons. Went for ammunition in the afternoon, got back to lines about 7 pm
Entry.95:
Grooming & cleaning harness.

Harness & kit always to be together so as to be able to move off at an hours notice

Blangy Tronville
Entry.99:
Left Blangy Tronville 12 noon. Arr. At our next stopping place (about a Kilo outside Boves) about 2 pm. Fixed up lines then build our dugouts. Camped in an orchard (About seven kilos from Amiens.)

Boves near Amiens
Entry.100: Grooming and cleaning harness Fritz dropping bombs all round our camp
Entry.105: Left the lines with the Captain at 2-30 pm. Went to Paymaster to get my tele. remittance from Aust. put in pay book. Stayed over night with the section
Entry.106:
Left Contay at 10-30 am. Had dinner at Allanville. arr. back to lines at Boves about 4 pm.

Went back as guide to limber with rations
Entry.108:
12 noon ordered to harness up. Left Boves at 1pm. and arr. Pont Noyelles. about 4 pm. Had billets to sleep in Tied mules on to waggons

Pont Noyelles
Entry.109:
Left Pont Noyelles 1pm. and arr. At our next stopping place Beaucourt about 4 pm. Made a dug out as the billets were very poor.

Beaucourt & Contay.
Entry.110: Cleaning Limbers in morning, left Beaucourt 1 pm. Arr Contay about 2pm.
Entry.116: Harnessed mules into mess cart & went to D.A.C. H.Q. at Beaucourt & 2nd. Div. Salvage dump with U.S. wheels Arr back to lines 12 noon, then sent to dump for a load of bombs. Dinner. 2pm. Harnessed up again & took bombs & rations to 6th Bdge. Got back to camp at 5 pm.
Entry.117: Mounted Guard S.A.A. beat the Tommy Art at cricket 120 to 54
Entry.120:
Warned to be ready to move off with "D" Sub at 9 am in the morning.

Rivery near Amiens

about 3 or 4 Kilos from Amiens
Entry.121: Left Contay with four mules in Limber at 10am. arrived Pont Hoyelles about noon, where we stayed for dinner, 2pm. off again and arr. at our destination Rivery about 3 kilos, from Amiens. Fritz great numbers of bombs
Entry.122: Rev. 6-15am. Stables 6-45am. 10-30 pm. Had to get out of bed, harness up, and go for a load of S.A.A. & brought it back to lines
Entry.123:
No parades, just fixing the ammunition on the limbers and G.S. Waggons. Had letter from J. Sanderson.

Rivery.
Entry.125: Cleaning out the mule lines & cleaning harness.
Entry.126: 2pm. Harnessed up and went with G.S. to the A.S.C. dump for rations.
Entry.127:
Grooming and grazing, went boating in the evening, 
came
 found a drowned soldier. pulled him out on to the bank. Had 
nothing
 no identification disk. By uniform a Tommy

Pont Noyelles.
Entry.129:
Batt. for 12 boxes of bombs. Took them to the 25th Batt. Mounted Piquet 7 pm.

10 Fri

Orders to pack up & move out at 9-30 am Arr. back to section at 12 noon. Camped about 1 Kilo from 
Pont Noyelles.
Entry.130: Went to Querreul for canteen stock. Sports at the section in the afternoon
Entry.132: Building a bomb break for mules Out with G.S. for timber for harness racks.
Entry.133: Harness cleaning Put mules over hurdles
Entry.134: Holiday in the afternoon and sports. at the second section
Entry.136: Grooming, and fixing the jumps etc. for our sports tomorrow.
Entry.137:
Sports started at 1pm but had to prospond them on account of rain 3.30 pm harnessed mules into mess cart and took Lieut Mar’s to rest camp near Longchamps. Arr there just on sunset. Tied mules to trees and slept under as it was a lovely night

Longchamps.
Entry.138: Left Longchamps about 8am. & returned to section arr home 1 pm. Inspection by General
Entry.140: 8.30am Left lines & went to Heilly salvaging shell cases & old clothing back to lines about 1pm. Fritz shelling Heilly.
Entry.141:
Painting in the morning

S.A.A. Sports in the afternoon.

Pont Noyelles.
Entry.142: Went to Allonville for rations etc.
Entry.146: 6pm. Went to T.M. Pits with a load of bombs Had to wait until dark as Fritz could observe. road. Got into Gas coming home & a few stray bullets. Back to lines at 2am
Entry.147: Did not get out of bed till near 11 am.
Entry.148:
Carting for bomb breaks

Concert in the evening.
Entry.149: 1 pm. Went to ordinance with limber between St Gratia & Coisy
Entry.157:
Carting rations to T.Ms Pits at well 
passe.
 forward of Mericourt. Not allowed to trot mules as the enemy lines were very close. Enemy 
sh
 sending a few shells into village but got home all safe (see 9th.)
Entry.162: 9 am. Carting rations for T.M. battery’s Got back to lines about 8 pm.
Entry.164: Packing up ready to move camp
Entry.165:
10-30 am Left Pont Noyelles. Arrived Rivery about 1pm. Building a dugout in the afternoon.

Rivery.
Entry.176: G.S. Waggon to Allonville for rations.
Entry.179: Took load of S.A.A. to 5th Bdge.
Entry.182: Loading waggons ready to shift camp.
Entry.183:
"B & D" Subs: packed up and left Rivery at 10 am. & arr. Lamotte Brebiere about 11-30am. Dug in and had dinner. Ordered to move out again about 1 pm. Arr. Glisy 3 pm. 

Pitched our camp near river.

(Following up the 5th Bdge )

Glisy
Entry.185:
Standing to

Our Artillery put up a very heavy bombardment. Fritz dropping bombs near camp
Entry.186:
Left Glisy at 10am. Arr. Rivery about 11am. Building dugout the rest of the afternoon.

Rivery.
Entry.190:
Grooming and cleaning harness.

Rivery.

Lomotte Baebiere.
Entry.193:
2pm. Limber to bomb dump. Carting water from Glisy water point to dump

Lomotte Baebiere
Entry.197:
Left lines 8-30am & brought two loads of wool from Villers Bretonneux mills to Salvage dump at Blangy Tronville

Front line about 200 yards from Villers Brettonneux.

Glisy.

D.A.H.Q.
Entry.198: Reported to D.A.H.Q. for position of Draughtsman Drawing office & sleeping quarters about 50 feet under the surface.
Entry.199:
Out of bed 7-30am breakfast 8am. office 9am, Dinner 12-30 pm. Tea 4-30pm. making out charts of Hostile shelling & 
Harrass
 harassing fire till 11-30 pm.

received advice from Commonwealth Bank re. money from Australia
Entry.201: Sent letter to Bank London telling them to send £20. to Glasgow
Entry.208: Sent letter to Bank telling them to send the £20 to Glasgow
Entry.211: Received large box of cigarettes from Jess
Entry.213:
Draughtsman returned 
from Blighty,
 so had to return to S.A.A. section as I was only relieving

Lamotte Baebiere
Entry.214: Took waggon load of M.G. Amm. to Villers Brett.
Entry.217:
Mounted guard at 10am.

Big Push starts in the morning.

Villers Brettonneux.
Entry.218: When on the 4 to 6 am shift the horizon was lit up with the flashes from our guns Planes going over by the score all night & thousands of Cavalry going up the line. Came off guard 10am
Entry.219: Took S.A.A. to Villers Brettonneux, back to camp 1 pm. Packed up & left Lamotte at 4 pm. Camped outside Villers Brettonneux. Fritz bombing all night not far from our lines
Entry.220:
2pm Moved off to another camp. Fritz shelling main road so took cross country track. Arr Bayonvilles & dug in Fritz bombing very close to camp. Camped just on the outside of village

Clisy

BAYON-VILLES
Entry.221:
2nd D.A.H.Q.
 

About 4pm got hit with Piece of Shrap in left forearm, taken to No. 53. CC.S
Entry.222: 12 noon taken by red & train to ROUEN "The best of attention from the Red + staff.
Entry.223:
Arr. 
ROUEN
 at 2am. then taken from station to No. 5 General Hospital by motor. (about 3 miles from station) Into bed just on day break.
Entry.224:
Had Xrays on arm Piece of Shrap still in

Fritz over Rouen bombing Had to get out of Marquee & get into sand Hut. Raid over in an hour

Rouen
Entry.225:
D.A.H.Q

Arm examined by Major for "Blighty" in the afternoon and issued with uniform for the trip over. Fritz again Rouen.
Entry.226: Left No. 5. Hospital by motor at 12 noon. Entrained & left Rouen about 2-30pm. Arr. Le Hauve 6-30 pm. then taken to the Casino Hospital on the Prom for the night AIR Raid warning Had to get into cellars
Entry.227:
LE HAUVE

Left the Casino 3-30pm & boarded 
Draughtsman returned from Blighty leave so had to return to S.A.A. Section

Gloucester Castle at 3-45pm Pulled out at 5-30pm & lay off till 10 pm Great number of wounded Germans on board. Pipe & tobacco & cigarettes from Shipping Coy.

Lamotte Baebiere.

ENGLAND
Entry.228:
Took waggon load of M.G. Am. to Villers Brettonneux

19 Mon

Arr. Southampton Painting waggons

20 Tues

21 Wed

Mounted Guard 10 am Big Push starts

England (Brighton)
Entry.229:
Arr Southampton 10 am Left Sth Hampton by train at 5 pm. Arr Brighton 7 pm.

19 Mon

In D.3. Ward Kitcheners Hospital. Allowed out of bed after inspection by Doctor.
Entry.230: As I was a walking case, I was allowed leave into Brighton from 2 till 9 pm.
Entry.231:
All the concerts etc on the Piers free to the wounded Splendid sisters in Hospital.

Brighton
Entry.232:
Leave into Brighton from 2 till 
9 pm
 9-45 pm
Entry.234:
Leave into Brighton 2 till 9 pm

Harefield.

1st A.A.H. Hospital
Entry.236: Left Brighton in the morning. Arr London about 11-30 am. Had an hour in London. Arr Harefield about 2pm. Put into bed Trench
Entry.237:
In Ward 2

1st A.A. Hospital

Transferred to Ward 3.
Entry.238: Feel better so got up. X-Ray on arm Dr. Broadhead in next bed.
Entry.250: Allowed out of bed again. Wonder when I am going to get another attack.
Entry.252:
LONDON

7-15 am. Drew kit & left Harefield 9-50 am Got my pass etc. at H.F. Rd. then spent the rest of the day in London. Caught the 10-15pm train from Kings X for Edinburgh

23 days in Harefield

Edinburgh
Entry.253: Arr Edinburgh 8 am. Uncle met me at the station.
Entry.254: Paid a visit to the Forth Bridge, Art Gallery & Sir Walter Scotts monument. Went to Pictures with Jim & Meg at night
Entry.255: Went to the castle. Home for dinner
Entry.258:
GLASGOW

Arr Glasgow (Queen St) at 11-45am. Jeanie met me at the station
Entry.262:
Left Glasgow at 5 pm. Arr Edinburgh 6-15 pm

Edinburgh
Entry.263: Met Fred in Princess St, took him home for tea.
Entry.265:
LONDON
 

Arr London 7 am Spent the rest of the day in London.
Entry.266:
Reported to H.F. Rd. at 11 am. Got a day extension on account of railway strike Went to the Theatre at night.

London
Entry.267:
Another day extention.

Visited Miss Mc.Creery
Entry.268: Railway strike still on so had another day extension. 4-30 pm. Reported sick at H.F. Rd. Sent to Southall hospital (2nd A.A.H.)
Entry.269:
In G. Ward with Trench fever and Bronchitis

Southall Hospital
Entry.271: Southall (Middlesex) Just on the outside of London.
Entry.272: Southall (Middlesex) Just on the outside of London.
Entry.273: Southall (Middlesex) Just on the outside of London.
Entry.293: Allowed out of bed for 2 hours.
Entry.294: Told not to leave the ward, but I had enough of it, so went into London in the afternoon.
Entry.298: Met Miss Golding at Ealing Broadway
Entry.300: 12-30 pm Left Southall & went to see "Shanghai" at Drury Lane Theatre. Expenses paid by the members of the Melbourne Stock Exchange
Entry.301:
Went to see 
the
 "The Law Divine" at Wyndhams Theatre After the show taken to the Victorian League for tea
Entry.302: Harry Lauder’s concert at the Pavilion.
Entry.304:
Spent the afternoon in London with Miss Golding & Miss M. Prestwick.

Southall Hospital.
Entry.305: Spent the day with Miss Prestwick
Entry.307:
Went with party to Windsor Castle

Tea with Princess Alice
Entry.311:
Went with Party to Alambra Theatre After show met by red cross lady and taken to tea at the League near Leicester Square

Southall. Hospital
Entry.312: Taken to Concert at Palladium by Miss Golding
Entry.313: Just got into Ealing Broadway when Guns were fired (at 11am) on account of armistis being signed
Entry.314: Went with party to the Palladium. Great excitement In London Flags hanging from every building, People singing & dancing in the street
Entry.315: Went to the London Opera House (Pictures) London in great spirits over peace After 3 pm the motors etc. could not pass along the street on account of the number of people
Entry.316: Spent the afternoon in Ealing Broadway
Entry.318:
Went with Party to the afternoon performance at Drury Lane theatre Ivy Shilling sent her photograph to every one of the boys. Tea at the Alwick Theatre Y.M.C.A. London still upside down

Southall.
Entry.320: Remained in hospital for a change.
Entry.321:
London

Had a look at King George, Queen Mary, Prince of Wales & Princess Mary driving along the Mall. Met W. Beaton in YMCA
Entry.322:
Spent the afternoon in London but went home early as it was very foggy. 

Got a lift from E. Broadway to Hospital by one of our cars.

Would never have got home otherwise at 
cars
 traffic at stand still

Sutton Veny (WILTS)

(Near)- 
WARMINSTER.
Entry.323: Discharged from hospital. In charge of two other patients. When we got to Paddington stn (London) we desided to have another day in London, before going into camp (Eight week in Southall)
Entry.324: Met the other boys at Paddington stn at 11-45am Left there by the 12-15pm train & arr. Warminster 3 pm. Took motor to No.8. Camp No.1. Command depot Sutton Very Wilts (13 Hut)
Entry.325:
Up before Dentist & Doctor for Classification

Sutton Veny. WILTS.
Entry.326: F.M.D. left camp Church Parade. Inline Piquet at 5-30 pm
Entry.329: Received letter from Mrs Cameron Box Hill. Sent Cable to Aust. for £40.
Entry.338: On the "NESTOR" boat roll for Australia & warned for draft Handed in Pay book
Entry.339:
Inoculation & medical inspection at No.5 Camp spent the afternoon in Warminster

Told not to leave the hut, may be marched off any moment

Sutton Veny
Entry.341: Handed in some of my kit to Q.M.S. issued with extra uniform.
Entry.342:
Filled in mail card for Base. P.O. Handed in kit for going in the 
Hold.
Entry.343:
Final medical examination before going on boat

Left Sutton Veny.

Issued with rations at Warminster
Entry.344:
Rev. 2-30am. breakfast 3 am fell in 3-30. Left camp 4 30am Left Warminster station at 5-30 am. Arr. Oxford 8 am 
Birmingham
 Birmingham 10 am. Crew. 12-15pm. & Liverpool warf 2pm Went on board the H.M.T.S. ‘NESTOR’ at 2-30pm. Tea at 6 pm 
"A" Dock No. 7. mess
 Cast off 6-30pm. & lay off in river Issued with blankets & hammocks
Entry.345:
on board H.M.T.S. ‘NESTOR"
.

weighed anchor 4-30 am. Breakfast 7am Dropped Pilot at 
Maidenhead
 Hollyhead. Dinner 12noon Tea 5pm. 
Very heavy swell. Very few of the boys came down for meals
Entry.346:
Took in mine catchers at 4-30 pm. Very heavy swell, & only a few of the boys came down for meals Went to bed at 7 pm.

On board. H.M.T.S. "NESTOR."

Hospital Ship.
Entry.347:
very heavy showers of rain

Issued with 2 suits pajamas, 1 flannel undershirt & underpants & 1 shirt, pair canvas shoes, 2 cakes soap, tooth soap, & HAT. writing paper, socks (1 pr) shaving soap & handkerchief from Red + in pillow cover.
Entry.349:
9am. Called in at Gibralta & left again at 10-30am.

"Nestor" doing 14 ½ 1,500 troops aboard.
Entry.350:
Boxing tournament and Concert at night.

Lovely weather and sea very calm

Issue of chocolate from Australian Red Cross

10pm Cable of mine sweeper broke so brought on deck

MEDI
Entry.352:
Passed Malta about 8am.

Nothing of any interest occurred.
Entry.353:
Concert in the Evening

H.M.T.S. "NESTOR"

Hospital Ship.
Entry.354:
Paid £2. (
Port Said.
) 

Arrived Port Said 9am, Natives all round the boat selling Fruit & silks etc Left P.S. 4-30 pm. Had search Light on bow going through canal

(Suez)
Entry.355:
Arrived Suez 8am. Argyleshire left Suez at 3am this morning for Australia. "Burma" arrived two hours after the "Nestor". 
Boys
 11-30pm boys officers & sisters singing carols on Every deck. Ringing ships bell etc
Entry.356:
Received parcel from Red X. containing tobacco 3 pk. cigarettes, jam (1 lb tin) chocolate Sultanas etc. 

Xmas Dinner. Roast meat, Goose, apple sauce, Plum pudding oranges, chocolate & cigarettes & beer. Left Suez 8-30pm. All night nearly all the officers well gone making speeches etc. Spent an enjoyable day.

RED SEA.
Entry.357:
Sports in the morning and afternoon.

"A" Deck won most of the sports.
Entry.359:
Very 
Cloudy
 windy Had to sleep down below, as blankets were blowing all over the deck

H.M.A.T. "NESTOR’

(Hospital Ship)
